Reviews.Title: “Price is good but poor service”
Reviews.Author: Pstrtj
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in we thought we were getting a good value. The room was average but it went down hill from there. We asked 3 times over a 3+ hour period for an extra pillow and blanket for our child. The first two times we were told it would be brought to our room. However, the third time I went into the office and asked again. I was told she was the only one on the grounds and did not have a key to housekeeping. We had also attempted to log into the wi-fi from 3 different items. Each time we were asked for a username and password. When I asked the front desk clerk what they were, she told me they weren't necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better!”
Reviews.Author: happybeans76
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a night because we wanted to visit Branson for Saturday. It was a birthday trip for me. We are from St. Louis so it was about a 4 hour drive and a late one for us. We got there and checked in. My husband checked us in while we waited in the car. I can't speak much on the check in process other than he didn't have any complaints! I take that as a good thing. When we got to the room it looked "cute". I was pleased that they put a crib/playpen in the room. It was sweet until I when to turn on the light on the side of the bed and it didn't work. Doh! I thought well maybe that was a small issue they needed to fix. We found that the rest of the lights worked fine. When the lights came on I remembered the reviews of " you get what you pay for." I would go a step further and say we got a little less than what we paid for. I've stayed in other hotels for less and it was cleaner! The good: The hotel wasn't hard to find. It has a unique theme, nice sitting area out side by the front. The size of the room fit our family. There is a small fun park right in front of it. Each room had a TV with decent channels. The bad: It has a small fun park right in front of it and one on the side which can be could be a good or bad. When we got there close to midnight the fun park to the side of it still had go carts going. So if you are sensitive to noise beware of that. the hotel needs updates. It wasn't as clean as it could have been. The front of the hotel looks unique but the rest of the rooms look like regular rooms. Wish they had carried theme on through to the rooms located in the back. The ugly: Ok so here are the things that made me never want to book there again, the bed wasn't good. My husband complained about his back hurting the next morning. We actually slept on the top and used a blanket. I saw the pictures of the stains on the mattress of the other review and it scared me off of getting comfortable. The beds in the other room looked ok. The kids didn't complain. I went to make coffee and saw the coffee pot was dirty. Yes dirty with stains I washed off. After rinsing it out and brewing the coffee I discovered there was a hair strand right next to it and another on the other side of the sink. It did not belong to anyone in our family. Yuck! There were two holes in the walls. There was mildew at the top of the shower curtain. The towels had red markings on them. The tub was dirty and the sink had a brown ring around the drain. The flooring wasn't clean and looked rather disgusting and there was a wasp in the kid's bedroom. Sorry to say that we won't book here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice pool”
Reviews.Author: Jamsum
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Windmill twice in the last year. The first time was in a family suite, which was clean and well worth the price. This time our family got two different rooms. Neither of them were extremely clean. The lady at the desk told us at check in that we would not be able to get a crib, that the hotel has recently switched ownership and that the last owner left it in a terrible state and they were in the process of remodeling. Which it does need. Every single staff person that we encountered was super nice and helpful. The so-so room was alright for the price and location. The pool is situated where you can see the strip and the Tracks while swimming but there is a nice little rock wall that surrounds it giving you a feeling of privacy. The pool is 3' across which is perfect for little ones or laps. You can see people on the big slides at White Water from the pool. I thought it was situated very well. We really enjoyed the pool, I only wish it stayed open later. It closed at ten which is just about the time you get out of attractions and want to come back for a nice lap before bed. Bummer. The kids loved the fact that it was a windmill and it was next to a building that has a massive chicken in front of it. The continental breakfast is alright, but you are in walking distance to the big chicken restaurant which has a buffet, Denny's and Krispy Kreme. For location and price this hotel is a winner.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Phyllis C
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean. The bed was as hard as woodpecker lips. My husband thought the floor might be softer. I think I'm a couple inches taller because the curves in my spine have been straightened out. I had read that the rooms were a little musty smelling so I took room freshener.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: CER88
Reviews.Content: If you want a really cheap place that you use just to have a place to sleep, this is for you. If you are looking for something nice with some nice amenities, this isn't for you. The room kind of had a funky smell and everything in it was older. The bedding seemed to be from the early 90's or 80's. My fiance has bad allergies and something in the room caused them to flare up bad. Had to wake up at 6 a.m. one morning to go get medicine. Also, the room either felt like we were on the sun or in the Arctic. No in between on the temperature. We expected to have a place like this for $40 a night. For what we payed we were happy since we just wanted a place to sleep. For a family, I would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Windmill Inn”
Reviews.Author: brittany k
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Windmill Inn this past weekend. For 39.95 you get exactly what you pay for. The room was average on cleanliness. We didn't have to go to the front desk for anything during our stay, but when we checked in they were very nice. The room did smell very musty, but like I said you get what you pay for. If you are just looking for a room to go to sleep in, then this will be fine for you. The motel is located on the strip but not really within walking distance of the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay. Will be back”
Reviews.Author: mswilliams96
Reviews.Content: The price for the room was very reasonable and the location was perfect. Our housekeeping staff was super friendly as were the people at the front desk. The room may have been a little outdated, but it was very clean and comfortable. It suited our needs perfectly. The only downside was the breakfast. Wasn't really anything to it. We didn't use the pool but it looked very clean also.

Reviews.Title: “Nice motel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: My husband & I were very pleased with the clean motel and the friendly staff, Shaylie Phillips & David Jarrell were extremely nice and friendly. We would stay there again, & the price was very reasonable. We were on our way to Kansas from Georgia.

Reviews.Title: “Love it for the Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler64158
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I checked in for 4 days and 3 nights, it was $34 a night and was great. Could use some updating on the decor, however clean and great location. Staff was very nice and friendly, good cont. breakfast and little great pool! Have stayed multiple times in the past and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and Cute”
Reviews.Author: Lunarbuni
Reviews.Content: We stayed the first day the new owners took over and our visit was nice. Staff seemed pleasant. Rooms were clean. It's a bit older and to some it might seem like it needs a bit or remodeling, but to me it seemed very cozy. It's in a nice area. Breakfast was great. Very clean breakfast area. We enjoyed our stay and will stay again some day. If you want something different they have loft rooms...very cool. Beds are a bit hard, but the covers were very nice. Not all nasty and burned like a lot of hotels are.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: David J
Reviews.Content: We were visiting family in Branson and stayed at the Windmill Inn next to the Big Chicken Place on the strip. The price was great $39.95 and the staff was very friendly and the room was clean. Just what we were looking for. The location was great too, because my wife was able to just walk to Tanger to go shopping. I stayed in the room and relaxed! Overall we had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: NanaBonnie
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect place for our family vacation. We were at a well-known hotel across the highway for the previous two nights & moved over to the Windmill Inn because we were miserable at the other place. The firm beds were so comfortable....far better than the soft, sagging mattresses at the other place! The Windmill had 2 large bedrooms with an adjoining bathroom area. It was more than spacious enough for our family of 6. It is an older hotel & not a 4 star, but the amenities & staff more than make up for it. The price & location will definitely keep us coming back!!

Reviews.Title: “worst Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Sherri J
Reviews.Content: My brand new husband and I went here for our honeymoon. The directions we got were wrong, the reservation we confirmed three times was unavailable, the grout around the indoor pool was black and moved, the indoor jacuzzi took over 7 hours to drain out, and the spa had a black/green moving film on it. Our room roof leaked upon my head during the rain we had. This was the most horrible start to my marriage.

Reviews.Title: “Had to change motels.”
Reviews.Author: agillia
Reviews.Content: I booked this motel due to the good price and great location. I travel for my job and am overall not a picky traveler. We had two rooms and my sister-in-law stayed in the other. All of us had severe back pain the next day from the HARD beds. I can't even describe how awful. We moved to another hotel across the hwy with pillowtop matresses. The room was clean, but definately needed updating. I would recommend to pay the $10 more for a better motel.

Reviews.Title: “A Dangerous Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: SKMTC
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE! We stayed here earlier this month and our car was broken into and several items stolen. The Branson police took over an hour to respond when we called, and the cop told us there were only 2 officers on duty the night our car was broken into. There is evidence that the hotel employees may be involved. The guy that checked us in was fired the day we found our car burglarized. The carpets are filthy. I spent hours cleaning our room when we got there. The Clorox wipes I used to clean the floor in the bathroom were black with whatever was on the floor. The tiles around the tub were detaching from the wall. The owner lives in California and has health problems, so they weren’t helpful with investigating the situation either. Can't share photos b/c our camera was stolen.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, But No Awesome Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Shawn D
Reviews.Content: The Windmill Inn is located in a perfect spot in Branson. It's in the middle of just about everything, and because it is right next to A giant America-themed chicken it is very easy to find. The rooms are definitely older, but they were clean when we got there. The one issue we had was that on one day of our stay, the maid who had charge of our room merely pulled the blankets up, and didn't bother to wipe anything down. She did, however, empty the trash. If the cleaning is going to be shortchanged somewhere, I'd rather have the trash gone than my bed made. The person working the counter when we arrived was AWESOME. He checked us in, answered a bunch of questions, and then recommended the Kirby VanBurch show as right up our children's alley. He was even able to get us tickets at a a very steep discount - something we always appreciate. The pool is clean and very relaxing, my kids loved ending the day there. However, the breakfast is VERY lacking. We specifically look for hotels with breakfast, and we only managed to eat this one once, it was so disappointing. It was also uncomfortable. The room is very quiet, and there is an attendant there. It's... uncomfortable. All in all - the hotel worked well for us. We didn't have to sit through any time-share spiels and it was (mostly) clean and comfortable. We really didn't spend a lot of time there, anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Just O.K.”
Reviews.Author: rej63
Reviews.Content: If your looking for location, this is it. Room very old (as most everything in Branson), but it was clean. Great if you need separate bedrooms-2 rooms separated by bathroom, very nice for traveling with teens. We do not spend any time in room when we go to Branson, so if its clean and cheap its good. In front of Tanger Mall, right beside one of the Tracks, next door to great restaurant. Swimming pool disappointing, as 3 feet all the way across.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in a city full of them...”
Reviews.Author: garnetfire
Reviews.Content: This was our first time and the Guesthouse Windmill Inn and I was pleasantly surprised. We stayed three nights at the end of August. The staff was exceptionally friendly. Room was great. We got the one with the jacuzzi and it was big enough for 4 people and plenty of hot water to fill it. It was a quiet hotel. Enjoyed the pool which was fantastic. It was next door to one of the Tracks Go Kart places so we just walked next door to ride them. They have an amazing restaurant next door, American Chicken and Steak, the best food I have eaten in Branson. We also walked to it from our room. Loved this place and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible, but not impressed.”
Reviews.Author: brett_levi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here about seven years ago and returned this month. The main reason for returning is that they have a family suite. The best way to describe the suite ia to picture a normal double queen room with a large bathroom at the back. On the back of the bathroom is a door going into another double queen room. If I remember correctly, it cost around $85. Not bad price, especially for the location. It is right up the hill from the Tanger Outlets. Staff was very friendly, and helpful. We did not try the breakfast, since the kids love going to Krispy Kreme to watch the donuts cook. Krispy Kreme is next door. The complaint is that it seemed dingy. The carpet felt nasty when you walked barefoot. Everything almost felt damp. I don't live very far from Branson, and am accustomed to the humidity, but this just made things feel a little gross. If you read my other reviews, I have found a much better family suite in Branson. I liked the people, but it just seems a little dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, met all the basic needs plus plenty of towels”
Reviews.Author: MomOfThreeOhio
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Windmill. The rooms were clean and well stocked with towels (traveled with 3 teenagers). The two bedroom suite worked out perfect. There were not a lot of frills, but we went to visit Branson, not stay in the room. The money saved was spent on activities in Branson. The location was perfect and had easy access to the entertainment. The breakfast was good, and the gentlemen was very friendly and made waffles for everyone. I believe I received more for my money and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Luvnutrition
Reviews.Content: Walls were very thin - the next door neighbor obviously had to sleep with the TV on - we could here it through the wall- all night! Room was small as was the tv - probably a 19" and very limited cable channels - only 1 kids channel. Had to crawl under the table to adjust the AC - had to do it by feel as it was so dark under there I could not read the settings. Bath towels are good for exfoliation (i.e. rough!). Breakfast room is WAY too small for the size of the hotel. The first day they ran out of donuts, OJ, biscuits and gravy and waffle batter by 8:00 am. Had to eat 5 SMALL bowls of Cheerios to even feel remotely satisfied. An older lady was working in the breakfast room and seemed very unorganized and flustered and could not keep up with guests' needs. The 2nd day was better as a gentleman was working in there and was much more calm and organized.. The pool was cloudy and kids were finding gross stuff on the bottom. We only stayed a few minutes.On a positive note, the beds and pillows were comfortable and the room appeared clean. I realize this is not supposed to be a 5-star hotel, however, expected a little more with all the competition in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good value”
Reviews.Author: RoseofTexas
Reviews.Content: Yes, this hotel needs some updating (like many on the strip). But the room was clean, with newly updated bathrooms. The king loft suite had a king (firm mattress) and full bath on the first level, and a double with a half bath in the loft (with a door to close out all noise and light!). Perfect for traveling with a teen who values his privacy and wants to stay up later. They were also offering deals for staying 3 or 4 nights which was great. Breakfast was good - waffles, doughnuts, cereals, biscuits and sausage gravy. Our only complaint - our non-smoking room smelled of smoke (as if 5 families ago, a smoker had stayed in the room). There was also an ashtray on the desk. We bought a bottle of Febreeze and sprayed the room. Either the hotel didn't "police" the room to make sure people staying in it didn't smoke (all the housekeeping staff we saw smoke so they would not have been able to smell the smoke in the room), or the housekeeping staff smoked in the room while cleaning it.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: RJ2Missouri
Reviews.Content: Nice pool and hot tub...Lots of clean towels in the pool area....Beds were double, NOT queens..Only one very soft pillow per person..No micro or fridge...cheap mattress...only working ice machines are in the main bldg... Breakfast included cold biscuits, but delicious gravy...make your own waffles...mostly lots of carbs..... Great water pressure in shower...Entire place is needing new carpet and paint...Very difficult to find Wifi service....Good location....Seriously doubt that we'll ever stay here again...Can stay down the road at the Howard Johnson's for same price....

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay. Night staff great. Stay away from the morning breakfast lady.”
Reviews.Author: travelinthedark
Reviews.Content: Our family of six stayed in a Family Room. The layout was nice--two bedrooms, separated by the bathroom. The bath and toilet has a separate door from the sink and mirror, so if someone has to use the facilities, it doesn't block anyone from moving from room to room. The rooms and bathroom were very clean. Everything was well stocked. Had a little difficulty connecting to the wi-fi, but the staff was helpful, and we eventually got it going without a problem. The night staff was wonderful. We got to Branson pretty late due to a flat tire, and when we arrived, we felt like it was a little too late to go do anything. The staff member told us we could get in the pool until their shift ended and they had to clean the pool. He also let my child use the employee restroom when it was obvious that my son might not make it up to our room. He was very friendly. The next evening guy was similarly friendly and helpful. Now, the woman who was running the continental breakfast was atrocious! I'm sure it is one of those things where she has been working there forever, and this has developed in her a deep-seeded hatred for all of humanity. She was a witch. First, we got there thirty minutes before it was supposed to end, they had run out of coffee, there was only one do-nut, gravy, but no biscuits. Two of my younger children wanted the one do-nut. She said, without being prompted, "What's here is here. Whoever gets it, gets it and that's it." I opted not to let either of my children have the do-nut and instead decided to make waffles in the waffle maker. There was a place for waffle mix on the counter, but it wasn't filled. There was a tub on the other side with plastic wrap covering it. I walked over and got a spoon and started to fill up my cups. Apparently, this was too slow of a process for her because she walked over and took my cup out of my hand! She then dipped the cup into the big tub of batter. Batter was everywhere. She handed it back to me without even wiping it off. I got batter all over my pants and had to change when I went back to my room. My other child decided on cereal. Both cereal machines were full, but there was no milk. I asked the lady if there was milk somewhere my kid could have for the cereal. She didn't say anything, but went back into the back, brought out a gallon jug, and slammed it down on the counter, and then walked away. This was good treatment compared to the lady who was behind me. Her waffle got stuck in the waffle maker, and the lady yelled at her about how she didn't leave it in long enough, that she was supposed to wait until it beeped. (There were no instructions posted anywhere on how to use this waffle maker.) The lady then made a big show of having to clean it, banging it against a sink, and sighing continuously as she scrubbed. She was so bad, the next morning I refused to go down for fear of running into her again. Other than this one crazy woman, the stay was delightful. (And really, in the end, she just reminded me of a very cranky, very southern grandmother.) Everyone else was super nice and friendly and the hotel was very comfortable. I would stay here again, but maybe go to IHOP for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “liars all liars”
Reviews.Author: jsnookiii
Reviews.Content: stopped in to get a room i had reserved, a king Jacuzzi. When we go to our room it was a Family queen. when asked the guy says "I gave you a free upgrade since our last jacuzzi room has a broken jacuzzi in it." He didn't even appoligize for not telling us. This was my Honeymoon and thats how it started. I would only go back if that gentelman was fired and i got a free stay. T

Reviews.Title: “Greatest staff. Will definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: jessie11_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right in the center of Branson with affordable pricing and is very clean. Has continental breakfast with a great pool and hot tub. The staff is exceptional and had great advice on where to go and what to see. The hotel was beyond my expectations. This is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay it's right on the strip.”
Reviews.Author: seabeecm1
Reviews.Content: The only place we stay in Brandon ! I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “We had a blast!”
Reviews.Author: lvbranson
Reviews.Content: I had friends coming into town for a big birthday party and I booked one of the family suites for them. In their words, "We had a blast!". The motel staff was very helpful, especially with their very late check-in (after the party). The room was spacious and comfortable and we had a great time popping popcorn and talking into the wee hours. We will definitely be back and recommend the motel to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the shopping”
Reviews.Author: doctorwho2
Reviews.Content: For those of you who do not know this motel is by the tanger mall, yet right across the street from the Moonriver theater. The bed was comfortable, the room clean, and the staff was fun, especially Nancy.

Reviews.Title: “It was fun”
Reviews.Author: firstapple2008
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Windmill inn in the past, and it was ok for the price, but this time the manager was unbelievable. She was looking over the hotel, and really cared about how the place was for the guests. The Windmill has always been the best location, now I believe it is the bbest in its price category. Clean, good breakfast, and fun staff.

Reviews.Title: “Will Never Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Husky1Fayetteville_A
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed. The bed was clean and fairly comfortable; but that was about the only positive thing we enjoyed (besides the location). The room smelled like chemical cleaners when we first entered, the carpet was old and stained, the paint was dingy looking, there was no iron, and the door lock to the outside door only worked the first night we entered the room. We had to ask the front desk to have someone come with a key to open the door each time we wanted back in our room. It was not fun waiting out in the cold wind to wait for someone to come open the door to our room. We were told for 4 days that they would fix the lock, but never did. Other neighboring rooms had the same problem with their locks. There were a lot of disgruntled guests during out stay. The word most used was "RIDICULOUS!" Will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Phil6793
Reviews.Content: Our family (two adults and four small children) stayed in a two-room suite for three nights. We had an excellent stay and found it to be a great bargain. PROS: It was clean and well-kept. The front desk staff and housekeeping staff were friendly and helpful. The pool area was clean and tidy. The breakfast area was clean. It appears to have been remodeled within the past few years, so everything looks fresh. It is within walking distance of Wal-Mart and one of the outlet malls. There are a couple of miniature amusement parks next door with lots of kid-friendly activities. There is a restaurant next door that serves an inexpensive breakfast buffet (about $5 per person as of this review). PRO or CON depending on your preference: The beds are firm and the pillows are soft but thick. CONS: If you keep in mind that this is an economy hotel, then you won't be disappointed. However, if the following things matter to you: There is no staff person on site between 10p-6a. The free continental breakfast is simple (donuts, two cereals, juice, coffee, toast, English muffins, and toaster waffles). The wall units that heat and cool the room are a bit noisy, but no more so than a wall unit at a similar hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE of this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mariemcarr
Reviews.Content: When we first checked into the hotel, we were given a room key. After walking to the building the room was in and opening the door, we realized we were given a storage room key. We walked back to the office to get another room. I advised the front desk clerk that I had reserved a smoking room and she said "your reservation did not request a smoking room" very rudely. I produced my reservation to prove what I had requested. The room smelled moldy and the tub was dirty. The vents on the air conditioner were broken and very noisy. The air conditioner is located under a table so it is hard to get to. On one of the beds, there was actually blood on the sheets. The internet connection is extremely slow and has been taken over by Branson ads. The listing on the website states that the hotel has movie channels. They have none. The website states they have a spa, but it is actually a home portable spa (that seats 5) but it was even closed/broken. The website states that the office is open 24/7, but it closes at 11 or 12. After returning to the room from going out on the town, I attempted to fill the tub; however, the water was scalding hot - no COLD water was available. I was unable to wash up at all and actually scalded my hand with the water. Since the office was closed, I had to wait until 7 in the morning to tell the front desk. The maintenance worked came to our room and said that this issue "happens all the time" and that you had to let the water run for about 15-20 minutes to get cold water because the hot water builds up in the walls. If I had a child with me, they could have gottten third degree burns. When I complained to the front desk the only thing they had to say was "sorry". DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!

HotelInfo.Name: Guesthouse Windmill Inn & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 2425 West Hwy 76 Country Blvd, Branson, MO 65616
